now.title: JIT compiler
now.description:
Compile Unison to native code.

First milestone:
JIT can compile enough of the language to power the backend of Unison Cloud.

now.title: Unison Cloud microservices
now.description:
Promote any Unison function to a typed microservice.

Turn any microservice into an autoscaled HTTP endpoint; call Unison-native services without serialization boilerplate.

now.title: Projects: milestone 1
now.description:
Dedicated commands for creating public or private projects and branches and publishing them to Unison Share.

A building block for collaboration features like merge requests and issue tracking, as well as nicer support for dependency management.

next.title: Projects: merge requests and issue tracking
next.description:
Support for creating and commenting on merge requests.

Structural, hyperlinked diffs and code comments.

Basic issue tracking.

next.title: Redesigned update process
next.description:
Code updates that 'Just Work', guiding users through structured refactoring sessions in response to changes.

More intelligent merge algorithms.

next.title: Stateful Unison Cloud microservices
next.description: Stateful services using Unison-native storage, without manual serialization code to/from a datastore.

later.title: Dependency management
later.description: Easy dependency management and library upgrades.

later.title: Graphical UCM
later.description: All the same functionality as UCM, but in a rich UI. Command palette with typeahead. Hyperlinked code viewing. Structural diffs.

later.title: JIT compiler: milestone 2
later.description: Support JIT of all Unison programs.

later.title: Extensible records
later.description: Support for extensible records. An extension to the syntax and the type system.

later.title: Advent of Cloud and Unison Cloud public beta
later.description: Unison Cloud open to all users, with supporting learning materials.
